_header: If all the earth were parchment scribable
Note:
Also forms last st. of 3184; for a companion piece cf. 5869. Cf. Opie and Opie (1951)
XIona Archibald Opie, and Peter Opie. The Oxford Dictionary of Nursery Rhymes. Oxford: Clarendon, 1951, 436; Linn (1938)
XLinn, Irving. “If All the Sky Were Parchment.” PMLA 53 (1938): 951-70, 951-67.
_description: An extract (lines 239-45) of The Remedy of Love (4801), here adapted to the praise of women

BLAdd17492.Transcription:
Yff all the erthe were parchment scribableSpedy for the hande and all
                    maner wodewere hewed and proporcyoned to pennes ableal water ynke in
                    damme or in flodeeuery man beyng a parfyte scribe or goodethe
                    feythfulnes yet and prayse of womencowde not be shewed by the meane off
                    penne
BLAdd17492.Editions:
Muir,  Kenneth. 
             “Unpublished Poems in the Devonshire MS.” 
             Proc. Leeds Philosophical and Literary Society
         6 (1944-52): 253-82: 278.

Banna.First Lines:
Gif all the erth war perchmene scribableMaid to þe hand And
                    all maner of wud…
Banna.Last Lines:
…The cursitnes And disset of wemenCowld not be schawin be the
                    mene of pen
